member.name: T:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1
member.summary: Base class for x86-family basic block lifters. Provides common infrastructure for x86, AMD64, and other x86-family architectures. Based on VEX guest_*_toIR.c pattern for code reuse.

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.CurrentInstructionAddress
member.summary: Current instruction start address for debugging/error reporting

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.MaxInstructions
member.summary: Maximum instructions to lift in a single basic block

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.MaxBytes
member.summary: Maximum bytes to process in a single basic block

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.ArchWordSize
member.summary: Architecture-specific word size (32-bit for x86, 64-bit for AMD64)

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.GetArchRegisterName(System.String)
member.summary: Get architecture-specific register name for operand conversion Override for AMD64 to handle extended registers (R8-R15)

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.GetArchOperandSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Architecture-specific operand size calculation Override for AMD64 to handle 64-bit default operand sizes

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.IsBasicBlockTerminator(CSEx.Lifters.X86.X86Decoder.X86Instruction)
member.summary: Check if instruction terminates a basic block Can be overridden for architecture-specific control flow

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.LiftBasicBlock(System.Byte[],System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Common infrastructure for lifting basic blocks Architecture-specific implementations override LiftInstruction

member.summary: Create architecture-specific instruction decoder Override for AMD64 to handle REX prefixes and extended encoding

member.summary: Architecture-specific instruction lifting Must be implemented by concrete classes

member.summary: Common helper for creating IMark statements

member.summary: Common helper for temporary variable creation

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseBasicBlockLifter`1.GetRegisterOffset(System.String)
member.summary: Architecture-specific register offset calculation Override for AMD64 to handle 64-bit register layout

member.summary: Common helper for register reads with guest state integration

member.summary: Common helper for register writes with guest state integration

member.summary: Enhanced helper for flag computation with guest state integration

member.name: T:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter
member.summary: Base class for x86/AMD64 instruction lifters with shared processor extension support Provides configurable word size, stack pointer size, and address width

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.ArchWordSize
member.summary: Architecture word size in bytes (4 for x86, 8 for AMD64)

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.StackWordSize
member.summary: Stack pointer increment/decrement size in bytes (4 for x86, 8 for AMD64)

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.ArchAddressType
member.summary: Address type for memory operations (I32 for x86, I64 for AMD64)

member.name: P:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.StackPointerRegister
member.summary: Stack pointer register for this architecture

member.summary: Create architecture-appropriate constant for stack operations

member.summary: Create architecture-appropriate binary operation for address arithmetic

member.summary: Create architecture-appropriate binary operation for address subtraction

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.LiftMMXInstruction(System.String,System.Object[],CSEx.IR.IRSB)
member.summary: Lift MMX instruction - works identically on both x86 and AMD64 MMX instructions operate on 64-bit MM registers and work the same way regardless of whether we're in 32-bit or 64-bit mode

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.LiftSSEInstruction(System.String,System.Object[],CSEx.IR.IRSB)
member.summary: Lift SSE instruction - works identically on both x86 and AMD64 SSE instructions operate on 128-bit XMM registers and work the same way regardless of whether we're in 32-bit or 64-bit mode

member.name: M:CSEx.Lifters.X86.BaseX86Lifter.LiftAVXInstruction(System.String,System.Object[],CSEx.IR.IRSB)
member.summary: Lift AVX instruction - works identically on both x86 and AMD64 AVX instructions operate on 256-bit YMM registers and work the same way regardless of whether we're in 32-bit or 64-bit mode
